content.description:
Depending on how you do it, around 15 moves of goodness will take you to the top. Start sitting matched on the tombstone flake, and make the hard, crimpy traverse left, topping out on the awesome moves up and right from the protruding jug.

Topout variations don't change the grade but might lose you a star.
content.protection: The landing is good, use 2 pads.
content.location: Start seated on the tombstone flake at the base of the prow.

content.description: Start from the huge undercling, and bop up the slab.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the boulder.

content.description:
Start as for

Duchess

, but move right using the awesome, protruding flake, and top out as for

We Three Kings

.
content.location: This climbs the far left end of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on The Tombstone, climb straight up, then trend left, and top out

We Three Kings

.
Start low on a nice left-facing, sidepull rail. Crank up to through a sweet pinch and solid edges to top out left. It is a good warm-up for the other lines on the boulder.
content.protection: It has a nice landing, use 1 pad.
content.location: This ascends the far left end of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on the sweet left-facing jug a few feet right of the prow. Make hard moves straight up before traversing left and then back right as for

Charlemagne

.
content.protection: Pads, it is nice to have spotters to shuffle the pads.
content.location: This ascends the right face of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on the tombstone, then climb up staying true to the prow until you can make a huge move to a jug on the right side of the arete. From here, top out the same as for

Charlemagne

.

Charlemagne is another climb fit for royalty. Sit start on the tombstone flake, work up through some amazing edges until you can trend left and relax on the large horn. From there, make easier but scarier moves to the right, and top out.
content.protection: Pads, spotters to move pads around are good on this one.
content.location: Start seated on the tombstone at the base of the prow.
